page.title: 17FARMOOR - Orrell
page.content: This home for the elderly has 50 residents,each having their own bed- room and sharing communal lounges and dining room.An alarm system exists for the use of residents in distress.Being a modern building there is a pleasant and cheerful atmosphere which is helped by a kind and friendly staff. Well tended gardens,for the use of the residents,surround the home.Visitors are welcomed at any time.The residents are from ordinary backgrounds.{Mary {Ellen Hitchmough}left school at 11 and went to work in a cotton mill.She had six children.She had the honour of becoming the Mayoress of Wigan.{ {Elizabeth Myres}also left school at 11 yrs of age,going to work in a private nursing home.Later she worked in a factory producing handbags.{Bill} worked on the railways for 25 years.He fought in the Second World War.
